newsitem.title: BELGIUM: TAP Air Portugal future bleak without alliances.
newsitem.headline: TAP Air Portugal future bleak without alliances.

text.p: Small or medium-sized European airlines like TAP Air Portugal will go under if they fail to find partners to strengthen their positions, the carrier's senior vice-president on Thursday.

Antonio Alfaiate said the state-owned airline was caught between two camps: the continent's larger airlines and alliances, with their economies of scale and extensive routes, and the low-cost, no-frills airlines now joining the market.
"The conclusion for us is very clear: a small or medium-sized air carrier like Air Portugal cannot survive in the near future (without partnerships)," he told an aviation conference.
Replying to questions, he would not specify which of the growing band of alliances his company wished to team up with.

"I think alliances with the big companies would not be a good choice because of course if we join British Airways or Lufthansa our capacity for negotiation of a good alliance is a very small one," he told an aviation conference.
"If we are in an alliance where the size of companies is more (balanced) then we can have a strong voice," he said.
